message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CG

Reasoning: The paper deals with hardness results for graph colourings and promise constraint satisfaction problems, which are central topics in computational complexity theory (cs.CC). The use of adjoint functors in the proofs suggests a connection to category theory and algebraic topology, which are relevant to the study of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The topology of the box complex also suggests a connection to geometric topology (cs.GT) and computational geometry (cs.CG).
